translated: Then the Buddha performed a feat of supernormal power such that Sela saw the Buddha’s penis concealed in a sheath.

translated: “The ascetic Gotama is endowed with the thirty-two marks of a great man, complete, not incomplete.

analyzed: yat nūna aham samaṇam gotamam sammukhā sāruppāhi gāthāhi
translated: Why don’t I praise the ascetic Gotama with fitting verses?”

original: Atha kho selo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ sammukhā sāruppāhi gāthāhi abhitthavi:
analyzed: atha kho selaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam sammukhā sāruppāhi gāthāhi
translated: Then the brahmin Sela praised the Blessed One in his presence with appropriate verses:
“Your body is complete, very lovely,
well-born, and beautiful to behold.
You are golden-skinned, Blessed One,
with beautiful white teeth and energy.
For a man well-born

original: ye bhavanti viyañjanā;🔽Sabbe te tava kāyasmiṁ,
analyzed: ye bhavanti viyañjanā  sabbe te tava kāyasmi
translated: there are the characteristics🔽and all these characteristics
are on your body, great man.
With clear eyes, a beautiful face,
lofty, straight, and radiant,
in the midst of the Saṅgha of monks
you shine like the sun.
A monk with beautiful eyes,
with a complexion like gold,
why do you have the state of a monk
with such a supreme complexion?

analyzed: rājā arahasi bhavitu  cakka vattī rathesabhaḥ
translated: You should be a king,
a wheel-turning monarch, a lord of the charioteers,🔽conquering the four directions,
a lord of the Rose-Apple Isle.
The wealthy kings, the nobles,
should be your followers.
As a king of kings, a lord of men,
O Gotama, rule the kingdom.”
“I am a king, Sela,
a unsurpassed king of Dhamma.
By Dhamma I turn the wheel
that cannot be turned back.”
“You claim to be a Sambuddha,
a peerless King of the Dhamma;
You say, ‘By the Dhamma I turn the wheel,’
so you say, Gotama.
Who is your general,
a disciple who follows the Teacher?
Who is it that follows you
after you have set rolling the wheel of Dhamma?”
“The wheel that I have set rolling,
(said the Lord)
the peerless wheel of Dhamma,
Sariputta follows,
born after me as a Tathagata.
What should be directly known has been directly known,
what should be developed has been developed,
what should be abandoned has been abandoned by me,
therefore, Brahmin, I am a Buddha.
Resolve your doubts in me,
have faith, Brahmin,
for it is not often that the appearance🔽of a Sambuddha is seen in the world.
For those whose appearance in the world
is not often seen,
I am that Brahmin, the Sambuddha,
the peerless physician.
I am the one who has become Brahma, the unsurpassed,
the one who has defeated Mara’s army,
having overcome all my enemies,
I rejoice, being free from fear.”
“Listen to this, sirs,
As the one with vision speaks.
The great hero, the surgeon,
Roars like a lion in the forest.
The one who has become Brahmā, the incomparable,
The one who has defeated Māra’s army;
Who, having seen him, would not be inspired,
Even if they were born black?
Whoever wishes to follow me,
Or whoever wishes to go away;
Here I will go forth,
In the presence of the one with good wisdom.”
“If you approve of this, sir,
The teaching of the Buddha;
We too will go forth,
In the presence of the one with good wisdom.”
These three hundred brahmins,
With hands raised in reverence,
“We will practice the spiritual life,
In your presence, Blessed One.”
“The spiritual life is well-proclaimed,
(The Buddha said this)
It’s visible, immediately effective;
Where the going forth is not in vain,
For one who trains with diligence.”

original: Alattha kho selo brāhmaṇo sapariso bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ, alattha upasampadaṁ.

translated: Sela the brahmin and his assembly received the going forth and the full ordination in the presence of the Buddha.

original: Atha kho keṇiyo jaṭilo tassā rattiyā accayena sake assame paṇītaṁ khādanīyaṁ bhojanīyaṁ paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālaṁ ārocāpesi:

translated: Then Keṇiya, with his own hands, served and satisfied the Saṅgha of monks, with the Buddha at its head, with excellent staple and non-staple food.🔽When the Blessed One had finished his meal and withdrawn his hand from the bowl, Keṇiya took a low seat, sat to one side,

The king is the face of the people,
and the ocean is the face of the rivers.
The moon is the face of the stars,
and the sun is the face of the hot.
For those who wish for merit,
the Saṅgha is the face of those who sacrifice.”

translated: They directly knew: “Birth is destroyed, the spiritual life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more coming to any state of being.”

translated: Then the venerable Sela addressed the Blessed One in stanzas thus:
“Having come to you for refuge,
the one with eyes, on the eighth day,
in seven nights, Blessed One,

you are the sage who has overcome Mara.

stand here with hands raised in salutation.

let the nagas pay homage to the Teacher.”
